column4: hello, unetbootin does not work, it complains of blkid not found suggests to install e2fsprogs. I have this installed
what should I do?
I want to install ubuntu. I wish to copy an ubuntu iso over to my usb pendrive, since my EEEPC doesn't have a cd drive
sudo updatedb && locate blkid
stefg I'm not using ubuntu right now
it might be easier if you run a ubuntu Live CD for creating the bootable USB stick
don't have a spare cd to hand
it's not too hard to do the tweaking by hand to make a bootable USB-Stick. Actually after making it bootable and installing syslinux all it takes is some renaming of files from isolinux* to syslinux*
yeah I followed the ubuntu USB howto wiki
but there's no help on how to copy over everything
I get "Not enough permission to copy symlink ..."
any help?
mount -o loop -t iso9660 /path/to/ubuntu.iso /some/mountpoint ... then cp -ar /some/mountpoint /dev/your_thumbdrive
it should really be on the wiki :(
ah here we go "cp: cannot create symbolic link `/media/fl/cd/dists/stable': Operation not permitted"
cp -ar /media/loopcd /media/pendrive  did not work!
it takes a while to get to the "cp: cannot create symbolic link `/media/pendrive/cd/dists/stable': Operation not permitted" message, as if it had been copying stuff
should I just ignore them then?
ot recreate them by touch /media/pendrive/dists/stable
ok.
booting from it now... fingers crossed
welcome to the wonderfu world of UTF-8
